title: Protocol Development I
requirements: For students in MSc in Epidemiology & Biostatistics
description: This lecture based course will cover important aspects of the development of a research protocol in public health research including how to identify a meaningful and feasible research topic, how to perform a thorough literature search, ethical considerations, questionnaire design, and sample size estimation.
outcome: Upon completion of this course students will have acquired the knowledge and skills necessary to develop a solid public health research protocol. They will know how to choose a research topic which has practical significance and that they are able to carry out effectively. They will understand the basic principles involved in designing a questionnaire and estimating the sample size which is sufficient to answer their research question. They will also know how to carry out an effective and exhaustive literature search and understand the role of ethical considerations in research studies.
syllabus: 1.Identifying a Meaningful and Feasible Research Topic2.Experience Sharing on Identifying Research Topics3.Conducting Literature Searches 4.Development of a Research Protocol  & Example5.Ethical Considerations in Epidemiological Research6.Sample Size Planning

title: Protocol Development II
requirements: For students in MSc in Epidemiology & Biostatistics
description: This course continues the process of guiding the students in the development of their research protocol through individual discussions between the students and their supervisors and student presentations to their fellow students and supervisors. The presentation groups will be formed consisting of about 6-9 students and 3 supervisors. The supervisors will provide feedback and advice to the students on the development of their protocol.
outcome: With the guidance of their supervisor and other supervisors the students will work through the process of the development of their own research protocol. They will learn about the practical application of the principles that they have learned in the Protocol Development I course. Through this process the students will develop an understanding of how to design effective research studies in the real world.

title: Research Thesis I
requirements: For students in MSc in Epidemiology & Biostatistics
description: Students will conduct the fieldwork and collect the required data for the thesis. This will enable them to apply the principles learnt in class into practice to deal with the practical matters regarding data collection. The data collection skills involved include determination of the variables to be measured, design of measurement instruments, validation of the instruments, and conduct of the fieldwork (of measurement). Students also need to present the progress of research.

title: Data Collection and Analysis for Research Thesis I
requirements: For students in MSc in Epidemiology & Biostatistics
description: Students will conduct the analysis of data collected in the data collection session. This exercise is a part of the completion of the Degree thesis and will enable the students to apply the data analytical skills to deal with practical problems in data analysis.

title: Data Collection and Analysis for Research Thesis II
requirements: For students in MSc in Epidemiology & Biostatistics
description: Students will continue conducting and complete the data analysis and prepare progress report for the Degree thesis. This will enable the students to further improve their analytical skills to handle the real problems encountered in data analysis. It will also reinforce what they have learnt in classes.

title: Writing Up of Thesis and Presentation of Results
requirements: For students in MSc in Epidemiology & Biostatistics
description: Students will complete the writing up of the thesis. Students will learn the style of scientific writing and how to write for scientific publications.
